html:
The holidays have arrived in New Eden so now you can use that time you might have spent doing the now nerfed AIR opportunities chasing Winter Nexus goals in EVE Online.

Winter Nexus 2024 is here

The Winter Nexus brings with is a series of rewards, activities, and sales… it wouldn’t be the holidays if somebody wasn’t trying to sell you something.

The first thing you are likely to note with the Winter Nexus is 33 days of login rewards… though everything after day 25 is a booster of a filament repeat, so if you get in 25 days of logins between now an January 7th you will have gotten all the good stuff, including 650,000 skill points for Omega subscribers.

33 days of login rewards

There are also the usual holiday items, plus the now obligatory SKINR materials and the endless parade of EverMarks.

Over in The Agency there is a new set of encounters for the Winter Nexus.

The seasonal encounter

There are a set of challenges, which include combat sites and mining sites, to go after.  Those earn you points and as you progress you can claim new rewards.

The reward track

This year the rewards include a total of 100 PLEX, along with the usual skill points, SKINs, and other items.  There are SKINR items on the list, but at least there are no EverMarks visible.

The sites spawn within the volatile ice storms, the GPU heating metaliminal storms, which wander around space, moving a system or two every day.  You can find them with the in-game map, one of its actual uses.  So, for example, in high sec, in Lonetrek, I see there is a storm centered in Sarekuwa.

The storm closest to Jita

The systems around Sarekuwa will all have event sites.  That one is handy due to its proximity to Jita, but it will be crowded because of that… and all the more so on day one as the try hards get in there early to get the event done ASAP.  (If you’re in Amarr, then Molea is your closest go-to.)

Among the rewards for the event are filaments that will transport you… and maybe some friends… to storms.  The day two login reward includes a high sec filament and you will earn more as rewards as you go.

In addition to all of that, there will be specials in the in-game and web store and, of course, Twitch drops to be earned by watching other people play EVE Online.  (Or not watching them, but leaving a browser tab running Twitch in the background.)  I do not know another game that is as into Twitch drops as EVE Online.

Anyway, there it is, back again.  I’ll probably be out there in the mining sites when I can.  Those are less obnoxiously competitive than the combat sites where some dude in a Vargur will drop in, insta-clear the site while you’re still working on your first target, and move on.  Time to get out last year’s Endurance ice mining frigate and get to work.  100 PLEX is 100 PLEX.

And don’t forget to mount your festival launcher and bring along some snowballs.  There is some easy event progress to be made with that.
